extendedIngredients.name: part skim mozzarella cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 12 sticks reduced sodium part skim mozzarella strong cheese

extendedIngredients.name: seasoned bread crumbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: 5 tbsp. seasoned whole wheat bread crumbs (store bought or homemade with Gina's recipe in the book)
metaInformation: with gina's recipe in the book)

recipes.title: Cheesy “Fried” Mozzarella Bites & SkinnyTaste Giveaway

winePairing.pairingText: Sparkling rosé and Sparkling Wine are my top picks for Mozzarella Sticks. If you're serving a selection of appetizers, you can't go wrong with these. Both are very food friendly and complement a variety of flavors. The Bellissima Sparkling rosé with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Bellissima Sparkling Rose
productMatches.description: This is an elegant, bright rosé, with hints of strawberry and grapefruit, and a soft, persistent foam. Uncorked at the very last minute, Bellissima Sparkling Rosé pairs perfectly with smoked salmon, shellfish, and seafood hor d’oeuvres such as tuna tartare, sushi, and sashimi.

recipes.instructions: Cut each string cheese into 4 pieces. Place on a baking sheet and freeze for at least 8 hours.In a small bowl, beat the egg. Put the flour in another small shallow bowl. In a third small shallow bowl, mix the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, and parsley.Line a baking sheet with parchment. Dip the cheese in the flour, then the egg (letting excess drip off), and then the breadcrumbs. Place on baking sheet and repeat.Freeze the bites for 1 hour. This is to prevent them from melting while cooking.Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with olive oil. Place the cheese bites on the baking sheet ad spray the tops with olive oil. Bake for 3 minutes and flip over. Bake for 2 more minutes or until melted inside. Watch carefully to make sure cheese doesnt begin to melt out of the breading.

steps.step: Cut each string cheese into 4 pieces.
Place on a baking sheet and freeze for at least 8 hours.In a small bowl, beat the egg.

Put the flour in another small shallow bowl. In a third small shallow bowl, mix the breadcrumbs, Parmesan, and parsley.Line a baking sheet with parchment. Dip the cheese in the flour, then the egg (letting excess drip off), and then the breadcrumbs.
Place on baking sheet and repeat.Freeze the bites for 1 hour. This is to prevent them from melting while cooking.Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Spray a baking sheet with olive oil.
Place the cheese bites on the baking sheet ad spray the tops with olive oil.
Bake for 3 minutes and flip over.
Bake for 2 more minutes or until melted inside. Watch carefully to make sure cheese doesnt begin to melt out of the breading.
